00028 # This module includes
00029 
00030 ## @brief This function converts a string into an integer allowing
00031 #  operations (+, -, /, *).
00032 #  
00033 #  The formula is calculated and the output is returned by 
00034 #  the function. If the formula contains floating point 
00035 #  values or results they're converted into integer at the end.
00036 def textToInteger(text):
00037         chars=['+', '-', '/', '*', '.', '(', ')', ',']
00038         chars=chars + [str(x) for x in range(10)]
00039         text = text.replace(',', '.')
00040         try:
00041                 return int(eval(text))
00042         except:
00043                 return False
00044 
00045 ## @brief This function converts a string into a float allowing
00046 #  operations (+, -, /, *).
00047 #  
00048 #  The formula is calculated and the output is returned by 
00049 #  the function. 
00050 def textToFloat(text):
00051         chars=['+', '-', '/', '*', '.', '(', ')', ',']
00052         chars=chars + [str(x) for x in range(10)]
00053         text = text.replace(',', '.')
00054         try:
00055                 return float(eval(text))
00056         except:
00057                 return False
00058 
00059 ## @brief This function converts a float into text. By default the number
00060 # of decimal digits is 2.
00061 def floatToText(number, digits=None):
00062         if isinstance(number, int):
00063                 number = float(number)
00064         if not isinstance(number, float):
00065                 number = 0.0
00066         if digits:
00067                 # Digits might come from the server as a tuple, list or a string
00068                 # So: (14,2), [14,2], '(14,2)' and '[14,2]' are all valid forms
00069                 if isinstance(digits,list) or isinstance(digits,tuple):
00070                         d=str(digits[1])
00071                 else:
00072                         d=digits.split(',')[1].strip(' )]')
00073         else:
00074                 d='2'
00075         return ('%.' + d + 'f') % number
00076 
00077 ## @brief This function converts an integer into text. 
00078 def integerToText(number):
00079         if isinstance(number, float):
00080                 number = int(number)
00081         if not isinstance(number, int):
00082                 number = 0
00083         return '%d' % number
00084 
00085 ## @brief This function returns True if the given value can be converted into
00086 # a float number. Otherwise it returns False.
00087 def isNumeric(value):
00088         try:
00089                 return float(value) or True
00090         except (ValueError, TypeError), e:
00091                 return False
00092 
00093 ## @brief This function converts the given paramter (which should be a number) into
00094 # a human readable storage value, ie. bytes, Kb, Mb, Gb, Tb.
00095 def bytesToText(number):
00096         number = float(number)
00097         texts = [ _('%d bytes'), _('%.2f Kb'), _('%.2f Mb'), _('%.2f Gb'), _('%.2f Tb') ]
00098         i = 0
00099         while number >= 1024 and i < len(texts) - 1:
00100                 number = number / 1024
00101                 i += 1
00102         return texts[i] % number
